title.narrative: Sub-Recipients to the Global Fund for HIV, Tuberculosis and Resilient and Sustainable Systems for Health (RSSH) programmes in South Sudan

description.narrative:
Integrating Services for Maximum Impact in South Sudan is a three-year cooperative agreement initiated on January 1, 2021, to provide to provide comprehensive TB and HIV/AIDS, service in 65 Health facilities in South Sudan in Seven states. The Six States covered by the agreement include: Central Equatoria State, Eastern Equatoria State, Western Equatoria, Upper Nile States, Unity State Jonglei State Including the three Administrative areas of Abyei, Ruweng and Pibor.
The Global fund project of the third new funding model (NFM3) has three goals: 1. Reduction of new HIV infections by 50% by 2023 2. Reduction of death among people living with HIV by 50% 3. Reduction of TB incidence by at least 30% (relative to 2019)
This will be made possible by Scaling up of HIV and TB Services through differentiated service delivery strategy and full integration of HIV, TB services and other disease Programmes by ensuring that implementing partners are closely monitored and coordinated with Cordaid and Ministry of Health.

The Global fund project of the third new funding model (NFM3) has three goals: 1. Reduction of new HIV infections by 50% by 2023 2. Reduction of death among people living with HIV by 50% 3. Reduction of TB incidence by at least 30% (relative to 2019)
The project targets to offer HIV and TB service to all generation and population inclusive of gender and age

participating-org.narrative: National Empowerment of Positive Women United

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Number of people tested for HIV

description.narrative: Number of people who been tested for HIV at health facilities supported by a Cordaid Health Programme

title.narrative: Number of health facilities with improved (technical) quality (score)

description.narrative: Number of health facilities (including Hospitals, Health Centers and Health Posts) with an improved (PBF/RBF) quality score within a calendar year; With quality score card current year > previous year (e.g. youth friendly services, SGBV, mental health); with improved quality for supported health service(s) within a calendar year
Number of health facilities contracted under a PBF Health project or supported through a non-PBF health intervention in a calendar year

title.narrative: % of of health facilities with improved (technical) quality score in calendar year

description.narrative: Percent of health facilities (including Hospitals, Health Centres and Health Posts) with an improved (PBF/RBF) quality score Q4 > Q1 of same year; With quality score card current year > previous year (e.g. youth friendly services, SGBV, mental health).

title.narrative: % of feedback and valid complaints received that are responded to/resolved

description.narrative: Percent of feedback and valid complaints received at project or country/field office level, via Cordaid, a partner or consortium member that are respond to and/or resolved (in accordance with Cordaid FCM minimum standards). This excludes invalid and sensitive complaints.

title.narrative: The project integrates climate risks in programming

description.narrative: The integration of climate risks in programming includes an undertaking of concrete actions to reduce and/or mitigate risks related to climate change impact and disaster risks ( for example droughts, erosion, salinization, flooding, etc.) The projects we refer to could be on the themes of health education, justice, security, disaster management, finance and livelihoods.
